snippet: Park Hee-tae, a six-term legislator, said he wanted to take “all responsibility” for the scandal, which has thrown President Lee’s governing party into further disarray.
abstract: Park Hee-tae, speaker of South Korea’s National Assembly, resigns as prosecutors investigate a lawmaker’s accusation that he had tried to obtain the top leadership post in President Lee Myung-bak’s governing party through bribery.
lead_paragraph: Park Hee-tae, a six-term legislator, said he wanted to take “all responsibility” for the scandal, which has thrown President Lee’s governing party into further disarray.

headline.seo: South Korea’s Assembly Speaker, Park Hee-tae, Resigns Over Bribery Scandal
headline.main: South Korea’s Assembly Speaker Resigns Over Bribery Scandal
headline.print_headline: South Korea: Speaker Resigns Amid Bribery Investigation
